subject: Law
title: Hazardous Waste and RCRA
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Hazardous Waste and RCRA.

hook.text: A factory produces toxic sludge. Where does it go? RCRA says: track it from creation to disposal. No shortcuts.

buildup.text: RCRA (1976) governs hazardous waste from 'cradle to grave'â€”generation, transport, treatment, and disposal.

discovery.text: Waste is 'hazardous' if it's ignitable, corrosive, reactive, or toxic. Generators must label, track, and store it.

twist.text: RCRA doesn't cover waste from before 1976. For old contamination, a different law applies: Superfund.

climax.text: Violations carry civil penalties up to $70,000 per day. Criminal violations can mean prison for company officials.

punchline.text: Waste doesn't disappear. RCRA makes sure someone is always responsible for it.

quiz.question: What does RCRA regulate?
options: Hazardous waste from generation to disposal
